org.vertx.java.core.net

Class NetClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vertx.java.core.net.NetBase
      • org.vertx.java.core.net.NetClientBase
        • org.vertx.java.core.net.NetClient

  • public class NetClient
extends NetClientBase

    NetClient is an asynchronous factory for TCP or SSL connections

    Multiple connections to different servers can be made using the same instance. Instances of this class can be shared by different event loops.

    This client supports a configurable number of connection attempts and a configurable delay between attempts.

    Author:
    Tim Fox

      • connect

        public NetClient connect(int port,
                java.lang.String host,
                Handler<NetSocket> connectHandler)
        Attempt to open a connection to a server at the specific port and host. host can be a valid host name or IP addresss. The connect is done asynchronously and on success, a NetSocket instance is supplied via the connectHandler instance
        Returns:
        a reference to this so multiple method calls can be chained together

      • connect

                Handler<NetSocket> connectCallback)
        Attempt to open a connection to a server at the specific port and host localhost The connect is done asynchronously and on success, a NetSocket instance is supplied via the connectHandler instance
        Returns:
        a reference to this so multiple method calls can be chained together

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the client. Any sockets which have not been closed manually will be closed here.

      • setReconnectAttempts

        public void setReconnectAttempts(int attempts)
        Set the number of reconnection attempts. In the event a connection attempt fails, the client will attempt to connect a further number of times, before it fails. Default value is zero.

      • getReconnectAttempts

        public int getReconnectAttempts()

      • exceptionHandler

        public void exceptionHandler(Handler<java.lang.Exception> handler)
        Set the exception handler. Any exceptions that occur during connect or later on will be notified via the handler. If no handler is supplied any exceptions will be printed to System.err

      • setSSL

        public NetClient setSSL(boolean ssl)
        If ssl is true, this signifies that any connections will be SSL connections.
        Overrides:
        setSSL in class NetBase
        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.

      • setKeyStorePath

        public NetClient setKeyStorePath(java.lang.String path)
        Set the path to the SSL key store. This method should only be used in SSL mode, i.e. after NetBase.setSSL(boolean) has been set to true.

        The SSL key store is a standard Java Key Store, and, if on the server side will contain the server certificate. If on the client side it will contain the client certificate. Client certificates are only required if the server requests client authentication.

        Overrides:
        setKeyStorePath in class NetBase
        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.

      • setKeyStorePassword

        public NetClient setKeyStorePassword(java.lang.String pwd)
        Set the password for the SSL key store. This method should only be used in SSL mode, i.e. after NetBase.setSSL(boolean) has been set to true.

        Overrides:
        setKeyStorePassword in class NetBase
        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.

      • setTrustStorePath

        public NetClient setTrustStorePath(java.lang.String path)
        Set the path to the SSL trust store. This method should only be used in SSL mode, i.e. after NetBase.setSSL(boolean) has been set to true.

        The trust store is a standard Java Key Store, and, if on the server side it should contain the certificates of any clients that the server trusts - this is only necessary if client authentication is enabled. If on the client side, it should contain the certificates of any servers the client trusts. If you wish the client to trust all server certificates you can use the NetClientBase.setTrustAll(boolean) method.

        Overrides:
        setTrustStorePath in class NetBase
        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.

      • setTrustStorePassword

        public NetClient setTrustStorePassword(java.lang.String pwd)
        Set the password for the SSL trust store. This method should only be used in SSL mode, i.e. after NetBase.setSSL(boolean) has been set to true.

        Overrides:
        setTrustStorePassword in class NetBase
        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.

      • setTrustAll

        public NetClient setTrustAll(boolean trustAll)
        If trustAll is set to true then the client will trust ALL server certifactes and will not attempt to authenticate them against it's local client trust store.

        Use this method with caution!

        Overrides:
        setTrustAll in class NetClientBase
        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.
